column2: LKQ Corporation Job Description    Date Completed:   06/Feb/24 Job Title:   Enterprise Integration Architect Salary Grade / FLSA:   Last Revised:     Job Code:  EEO Class: Reports to:   *Head of Enterprise Application Integration, LKQ Europe *Delivery Manager, EOS (Administratively), LKQ India Prepared by:    Kannan Velumani   Date:  25/Mar/24   Job Summary: The successful applicant will serve as the Enterprise Integration Architect for B2B and will lead technical integration of the design and solution delivery, supporting various system integration activities and facilitating discussions for architecture/design solutions that can be applied across the LKQ regions in Europe. The focus will be on EDI (Electronic Data Interchange) integration tools, business document creation routines, digital document storage and our middleware that integrates Oracle ERP with the eCommerce platforms in operation. This role will take responsibility for managing and reshaping integration, meeting the demands of IT transformation, and finding solutions for the Pan-EU third party application integration roadmap, all while applying best practices and guidelines.   Essential Job Duties: Acting as the single point of contact within Europe for all technical integrations with internal and external partners Managing EDI integrations by adopting existing tools and methodologies Maintaining and enhancing interfaces between Oracle ERP and our Output Management System (OMS) to generate and store customer and supplier-facing business documents Supporting the integration between our enterprise application solution landscape and the middleware for B2B and B2Cecommerce applications Establishing alignment with the IT solution owners and architects on the design of reusable and scalable integration solutions Supporting the end-to-end integration process according to the agreed roadmap, including providing consultancy during functional specification creation, development support, integration testing and implementation Traveling to attend appropriate business meetings on an occasional basis Embedding and embracing LKQ Europes cultures and values as we move towards one company with shared visions and goals. Be a Team-player and to have the ability to work independently.   Experience: Holds a Bachelors Degree in Engineering in IT  / Master?? in business administration or equivalent Minimum of 14+ Years of hands-on experience in the IT industry growing thru the ranks from a developer thru to an Architect Minimum of 3 years??experience managing service-oriented IT architecture and enterprise integration patterns Sound working knowledge of integration patterns, real time/near real time such as REST, SOAP, and API; Batch such as ETL and file transfer are advantageous Experience in Cloud infrastructures is desirable. Preferably, AWS cloud Basic knowledge in Security Topics, Methodologies and Concepts.  Ability to balance technical expertise with strategic thinking and leadership capabilities Able to identify critical issues and propose solutions Capable of handling scheduling, priorities and technical issues and working under pressure Strong interpersonal skills and experience collaborating in a multicultural environment Able to communicate effectively with different stakeholders such as business, technical, or senior management Ability to understand and articulate business requirements in order to translate this into technical integration solutions  Ability to work in a geographically dispersed team environment. Flexible to work in Europe CET Time Strong verbal and written communication skills in English Having worked in large organizations, managing vendor software development teams is considered a plus This role will be required to follow LKQI organizational policies and compliance requirements as well as adhering to organizational values and culture. column2: Responsibilities A day in the life of an Infoscion As part of the Infosys consulting team, your primary role would be to lead the engagement effort of providing high-quality and value-adding consulting solutions to customers at different stages- from problem definition to diagnosis to solution design, development and deployment. You will review the proposals prepared by consultants, provide guidance, and analyze the solutions defined for the client business problems to identify any potential risks and issues.  You will identify change Management requirements and propose a structured approach to client for managing the change using multiple communication mechanisms.  You will also coach and create a vision for the team, provide subject matter training for your focus areas, motivate and inspire team members through effective and timely feedback and recognition for high performance. column1: Hiring Salesforce Manufacturing Cloud Architect - Remote
column2: We are actively seeking a highly skilled and experienced Salesforce Architect with a strong background in the manufacturing domain to join our team. In this pivotal role, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and optimizing Salesforce solutions tailored specifically for manufacturing organizations. Your deep understanding of both Salesforce architecture and manufacturing processes will enable you to translate business requirements into scalable, efficient, and innovative Salesforce solutions.     Key Responsibilities: Solution Design and Architecture: Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand manufacturing processes, workflows, and requirements, and translate them into scalable Salesforce solutions. Design end-to-end Salesforce architectures that integrate seamlessly with existing manufacturing systems, ensuring data integrity, security, and compliance. Leverage Salesforce best practices and industry standards to architect solutions that support complex manufacturing processes, including inventory management, supply chain, production planning, and quality control. Customization and Configuration: Configure Salesforce platform features, modules, and components (e.g., Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Community Cloud) to meet specific manufacturing use cases and requirements. Develop custom Salesforce applications, objects, fields, workflows, and automation to streamline manufacturing operations and enhance user productivity. Implement advanced features such as Lightning Web Components, Apex code, Visualforce pages, and integrations with external systems (e.g., ERP, MES, PLM) to extend Salesforce functionality. Integration and Data Management: Design and implement data integration solutions to synchronize data between Salesforce and manufacturing systems, ensuring real-time visibility and consistency across the organization. Configure and optimize data models, relationships, and hierarchies within Salesforce to support complex manufacturing data structures and reporting requirements. Implement data governance practices, including data quality, data security, and data privacy measures, to maintain the integrity and confidentiality of manufacturing data. Performance Optimization and Scalability: Conduct performance tuning and optimization of Salesforce solutions to ensure responsiveness, reliability, and scalability for manufacturing use cases. Evaluate and recommend platform enhancements, add-ons, and optimizations to improve the performance and scalability of Salesforce applications within manufacturing environments. Collaborate with IT infrastructure teams to assess hardware, network, and integration requirements and ensure optimal performance of Salesforce solutions. Governance and Compliance: Establish governance frameworks, policies, and procedures for managing Salesforce configurations, customizations, and releases within manufacturing organizations. Ensure compliance with industry regulations (e.g., FDA regulations for medical device manufacturing) and data protection laws (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) when designing and implementing Salesforce solutions. Conduct regular audits and assessments to ensure adherence to governance standards and identify areas for improvement or risk mitigation. Stakeholder Engagement and Collaboration: Engage with business stakeholders, executives, and end-users to gather requirements, provide updates, and solicit feedback throughout the project lifecycle. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, operations, and IT, to align Salesforce initiatives with business goals and objectives. Build strong relationships with third-party vendors, consultants, and Salesforce ecosystem partners to leverage expertise, resources, and best practices for manufacturing solutions. Skills: Salesforce certifications, such as Certified Application Architect or Certified System Architect, are highly desirable. In-depth knowledge of Salesforce platform capabilities, including but not limited to Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Components, and Process Builder. Experience with Field Service Lightning and expertise in integrating Salesforce with ecommerce platforms (e.g., Salesforce Commerce Cloud, Magento, Shopify). Strong understanding of data architecture, data modeling, and integration patterns. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively interact with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. If you are passionate about leveraging Salesforce technology to drive business growth and operational excellence within the manufacturing sector, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and be part of a dynamic environment where your skills and expertise will make a difference.  Apply now!  meher.polisetty@rstartec.com  Don't share sensitive info. Chats may be reviewed and used to train our models. Learn more

column2: Danfoss is looking for a highly skilled SAP professional with project management and hands on experience to join the One ERP team as Business Consultants within the Forecast to Produce team (F2P)       F2P covers all production planning processes, both tactical and operational     The team plays a major role within the One ERP program and is connected to all other functional teams such like Finance, MM and WM, which makes this role exciting and challenging         As business consultant you will lead tasks in a release with its scoped entities from the legacy analytics till post go live support     Workshops, cross functional alignments, test and training planning and an active communication with experienced international business and IT colleagues are part of this exciting and rewarding role           In addition to contributing to the SAP S/4 HANA rollout across Danfoss     , the role involves participation in various developments     A significant upcoming project is the "Embedded APO," requiring comprehensive planning for the migration from the standalone APO system to the S/4 HANA embedded solution     Another major project is the introduction of eWM in Danfoss, involving the transition in distribution centers and larger warehouses connected to production                      The main responsibilities of the role include:                     Secure we have the best solutions for Planning available in our Template and continuously explore new technical options and developments from SAP.                     Gathering of requirements from local users, match them with our template solutions, making sure we have a fit. If not, then identify and clearly describe the gabs.                     Participate and lead the activities during a release, from requirements gathering, to development and test of solutions until Going live and Post Go-Live Support.               Background & Skills                   ?       You need to have good understanding of end-to-end business processes, especially those involving PP, APO and warehousing.            ?         Furthermore:                       You have strong skills in SAP PP module, with knowledge about business processes, flows and                         connected           master data and transactional data.                               Interaction with warehouse management including material staging and PP Kanban                         You have experience as consultant in global SAP upgrade/implementation projects.                     You are a strong communicator who can be assertive if needed and steer discussions to stay on track with the agenda.                 Employee Benefits               Bonus system                     Paid vacation                     Flexible working hours                     Possibility to work remotely                     Pension plan                     Personal insurance                     Communication package                     Opportunity to join Employee Resource Groups                     State of the art virtual work environment                     Employee Referral Program

column2: Your Role and Responsibilities As a Consultant you will serve as a client-facing practitioner who sells, leads and implements expert services utilizing the breadth of IBM's offerings and technologies. A successful Consultant is regarded by clients as a trusted business advisor who collaborates to provide innovative solutions used to solve the most challenging business problems.  You will work on projects that help clients integrate strategy, process, technology, and information to increase effectiveness, reduce costs and improve profit and shareholder value. You can take advantage of opportunities to master new skills, work across different disciplines, move into new challenges and develop a robust understanding of different industries.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise 4-12 Years of SAP Functional experience specializing in design and configuration of SAP modules using PI. SAP Cloud Integration- PI, Groovy. The consultant should have extensive experience in SCP (SAP Cloud Platform) technologies (APIM, PI, DI) and they will be involved in the migration work (BizTalk/SSIS to SCP-PI)  Ability to integrate Cloud applications with On Premise applications and Cloud with Cloud expertise  You should have at least one HANA Cloud Integration (HCI) project experience  Experience in Groovy Script, Java, XSLT, XML and Web Services experience is required .  Demonstrable experience in using PI/PO tools (mapping tools/editors) and proficient in different mapping styles (Graphical Mapping, Java Mapping, XSLT Mapping) and Interfaces using at least Advanced Adapter Engine (AAE) in PI 7.1 Ehp1. Experience in CI\\CD preferred.  Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Since our current integrations are developed in BizTalk 2020 (EAI) and SSIS (ETL) with .net code behind the scene, it is desirable to have these skills (not mandatory) on XML, XSLT, .Net are the technologies used in BizTalk 2020.  Exposure to APIM is desirable (not mandatory)

column2: Responsibilities A Day in the Life of an Infoscion As part of the Infosys consulting team, your primary role would be to get to the heart of customer issues, diagnose problem areas, design innovative solutions, and facilitate deployment resulting in client delight. You will develop a proposal by owning parts of the proposal document and by giving inputs in solution design based on areas of expertise.  You will plan the activities of configuration, configure the product as per the design, conduct conference room pilots and will assist in resolving any queries related to requirements and solution design You will conduct solution/product demonstrations, POC/Proof of Technology workshops and prepare effort estimates which suit the customer budgetary requirements and are in line with organizations financial guidelines  Actively lead small projects and contribute to unit-level and organizational initiatives with an objective of providing high quality value adding solutions to customers. If you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate the next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you! Technical and Professional Requirements: We are looking for candidates having a minimum of 5 years of hands-on experience in Oracle Fusion Middleware-based technologies like Fusion Middleware, SOA Suite, OSB, OBPM, Oracle ADF, and Oracle Data Integrator.  Candidates should have a piece of strong conceptual knowledge and experience in XML/XSD/X Query/XSLT, WSDL, and Service Oriented Architecture.  Candidate needs to have the ability to develop and deploy SOA components using OIC/ ICS, BPEL, OSB, and ADF components.  Rapid prototyping experience using SOA components on the Weblogic platform, and experience in FMW 11g to 12c migrations is preferred.  Experience and desire to work in a management consulting environment that requires regular travel.  Preferred Skills: Technology->Oracle Fusion Technology->Fusion Middleware  Additional Responsibilities: Ability to develop value-creating strategies and models that enable clients to innovate, drive growth, and increase their business profitability  Good knowledge of software configuration management systems Awareness of the latest technologies and Industry trends  Logical thinking and problem-solving skills along with an ability to collaborate Understanding of the financial processes for various types of projects and the various pricing models available Ability to assess the current processes, identify improvement areas and suggest the technology solutions  One or two industry domain knowledge  Client Interfacing skills Project and Team management  Educational Requirements MTech,MSc,MBA,BTech,BSc,Bachelor of Engineering  Service Line Enterprise Package Application Services *  Location of posting is subject to business requirements

column2: We are seeking a highly skilled OHCM (Oracle Human Capital Management) Techno-Functional Resource to join our team. The ideal candidate will play a critical role in supporting our HR and Payroll systems by effectively bridging the gap between technical and functional aspects of OHCM. This role involves collaborating with various stakeholders, including HR, IT, and business teams, to streamline HR and Payroll processes using OHCM.       Responsibilities:       System Configuration and Customization:       Configure and customize OHCM modules to align with business requirements.         Implement changes, enhancements, and updates to OHCM to improve system efficiency and functionality.       Technical Support:       Provide technical support for OHCM-related issues, troubleshooting and resolving system problems.         Collaborate with IT teams to ensure system availability and performance.       Functional Expertise:       Serve as a subject matter expert (SME) in OHCM, understanding business processes and translating them into system solutions.         Analyze HR and Payroll processes and recommend OHCM solutions for process optimization.         Integration and Data Management:       Manage data interfaces and integrations between OHCM and other systems.       Ensure data integrity and accuracy within OHCM modules.         Reporting and Analytics:         Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using OHCM reporting tools.         Provide data insights to HR and business stakeholders for informed decision-making.       Training and Documentation:       Conduct OHCM training sessions for end-users and create user-friendly documentation.         Keep documentation up to date with system changes and enhancements.       Compliance and Security:       Ensure OHCM system compliance with relevant regulations and security standards.         Collaborate with security and compliance teams to implement necessary controls.       Collaboration:       Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and implement OHCM solutions.         Work closely with HR and Payroll teams to understand their needs and provide support.         Qualifications:Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.         Proven experience as an OHCM Techno-Functional Resource or similar role.         In-depth knowledge of Oracle Human Capital Management (OHCM) modules.         Strong understanding of HR and Payroll processes.         Proficiency in OHCM system configuration and customization.         Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.         Strong communication and interpersonal skills.         Ability to collaborate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.         Experience with OHCM reporting tools and analytics is a plus.OHCM certification is desirable.         Workflow Builder.         Proficient in SQL and PL/SQL for data analysis and report development.         Familiarity with HR business processes and understanding of industry best practices.         Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to effectively troubleshoot and resolve system issues.         Strong communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with stakeholders at various levels of the organization.         Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented environment, managing multiple priorities and meeting deadlines.         Oracle HCM Cloud certification is a plus.

column2: SAP BASIS Expertise: Senior Functional Consultants in SAP BASIS have deep knowledge and experience in administering SAP systems, including installation, configuration, and maintenance of SAP components     Business Process Alignment: They collaborate with business stakeholders to understand the organization's business processes and requirements     This involves mapping business processes to SAP functionalities and ensuring that the SAP system supports business operations     System Implementation and Upgrades: Consultants may be involved in implementing new SAP systems or upgrading existing ones to align with changing business needs     They assess the impact of system changes on business processes     System Landscape Design: They assist in designing the SAP system landscape, which includes development, quality assurance, and production environments     The landscape design should facilitate efficient and controlled development and testing     User Management: SAP BASIS Consultants manage user access and permissions to ensure that authorized users have the appropriate level of access to SAP systems, in line with business requirements     Security and Compliance: They work on SAP system security measures to protect data and ensure regulatory compliance     This includes managing security roles, profiles, and authorizations     Data Management: SAP BASIS Consultants oversee data management, including data archiving, backup, and recovery processes to safeguard critical business data     Performance Monitoring and Tuning: They monitor the performance of SAP systems and take actions to optimize system performance, ensuring that SAP applications meet business performance expectations     SAP Transport Management: They manage the transport of changes from development to production systems, ensuring that changes do not disrupt business processes     System Upkeep and Maintenance: Consultants are responsible for the ongoing maintenance and patching of SAP systems to address vulnerabilities and ensure system stability     Disaster Recovery Planning: SAP BASIS Consultants design and implement disaster recovery and business continuity plans to ensure system availability and data integrity

Job Summary : As an Oracle HR Helpdesk (HRHD) Techno-Functional Consultant, you will play a pivotal role in bridging the gap between technical capabilities and functional requirements. You will collaborate closely with US-based workstream leads to understand client HR processes, configure HRHD solutions, and ensure successful integration. Essential Functions : - Engage with workstream leads to comprehend client HR processes, identify challenges, and propose tailored HRHD solutions that align with their objectives. - Develop comprehensive technical and functional specifications based on client needs, including data modeling, data import/export, data conversion, system architecture, and workflow design. - Configure Oracle HRHD modules, ensuring smooth integration with other HR systems and databases. Implement data migration and/or legacy data conversion strategies where necessary. - Develop and implement custom solutions and extensions using Oracle technologies such as Application Composer, Groovy scripting, Import/Export Manager(s), and Visual Builder Service (VBS) to meet unique client requirements. - Implement application security to meet client requirements  - Conduct thorough testing of HRHD configurations and customizations to guarantee system reliability, accuracy, and compliance with industry standards. - Provide training documentation as needed for clients' HR teams on system usage, ensuring efficient adoption and utilization of HRHD features. - Provide ongoing technical support, troubleshooting, and system maintenance to ensure the continuous functionality of HRHD systems. - Maintain detailed documentation of project implementations, configurations, and changes for future reference and auditing. - Build analyses and dashboards using OTBI/BIP reports to meet client requirements. - Expertise in Oracle CX Cloud notification features and implementation. - UI design, especially in Redwood  - Provide vital configuration support for HRHD/ODA systems, ensuring they align with client needs and industry standards. - Work closely with onshore leads to create comprehensive documentation to maintain clear and organized project records, including configuration workbooks and design documents. Duties/Responsibilities : - Maintain and pursue continuing education opportunities, such as training and certification exams. - Participate in internal projects. - Provide expertise and help to others, as needed, on projects. - Performs other duties as assigned. Competency : - Thorough understanding of information technology procedures and practices. - Thorough understanding of integration technologies such as REST and SOAP - Flexible to changing needs. - Organized with attention to detail. - Good at follow-up - Willingness to get hands-on with the product. - Works well with a team - Excellent verbal and written communication skills - Excellent analytical, logical thinking, and problem-solving skills. - Thorough understanding of HCM principles and planning. - Proficient with, or able to quickly become proficient with, a range of general and specialized applications, software, and hardware used in the organization and the industry. - Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software. Physical Requirements : - Prolonged periods sitting or standing at a desk and working on a computer. - Bending, sitting, lifting, and/or driving. Position Type and expected hours of work : - Full-time work during Apex IT business hours and, at times, outside of business hours, if required.(this is a call out for current IBU business working hours is not the same as US and/or client but has overlap with current client project time zone as decided in collaboration with client, PMO, Delivery and IBU leadership) Required Education and Experience : - Bachelor's degree in Computer or Information Science-related field or commensurate experience required.  - Successful completion of 2-3 implementations of HR Helpdesk (HRHD) including at least 1 with Oracle Digital Assistant (ODA)  - Exposure to HRHD for use with Union Grievances, Health & Safety incidents, Performance Improvement Plans or other specialized use of HRHD outside of standard ticketing functionality of HRHD  - Understanding of HR processes and best practices  - Experience configuring Cloud Security, UI updates and Notifications that are HRHD/ODA specific - Proficiency in designing reports and dashboards within HRHD ticketing system to enhance tracking of the client's service level, speed and accuracy of issue resolution - Experience with Oracle Digital Assistant's dialog flow patterns for customized builds beyond out of the box bot intents/skills/questions
column11: Oracle HRHD, technical support, Oracle Integration, OTBI, troubleshooting, Oracle HRMS, SOAP

column2: Role Description We are hiring for Oracle HCM Functional professional, As an Oracle HCM Functional, you will be responsible for day-to-day tasks related to Oracle HCM Functional. This is a hybrid role, located in Bengaluru with the flexibility for some remote work. Responsibilities: Business Analysis and Requirements Gathering: Work closely with HR departments and business stakeholders to understand their needs, challenges, and desired functionalities within the Oracle HCM suite. Analyze current HR processes and identify areas for improvement through system automation and data integration. Translate business requirements into clear and concise functional specifications for the technical team. Implementation and Configuration: Configure Oracle HCM modules (e.g., Core HR, Payroll, Talent Management, Benefits) to meet the specific needs of the organization. Develop workflows, automate processes, and define data mapping rules within the HCM system. Collaborate with technical consultants to ensure smooth integration with existing IT infrastructure. Testing and User Acceptance (UAT): Develop and execute test plans to ensure the functionality and accuracy of the implemented system. Work with HR users during UAT sessions to identify and address any issues or training needs. Training and Change Management: Develop and deliver training materials for HR users on navigating and utilizing the new Oracle HCM system. Facilitate the adoption of the new system by addressing user concerns and promoting best practices. Create and maintain user documentation for ongoing reference. Post-Implementation Support: Provide ongoing support to HR users after system implementation, addressing questions and resolving any technical issues. Monitor system performance and identify opportunities for further optimization. Stay up-to-date on the latest Oracle HCM features and updates. Qualifications Strong experience in Oracle HCM Functional Proficiency in Oracle HCM modules - Core HR and Performance Management Good understanding of HR processes and systems Experience in implementing and supporting Oracle HCM solutions Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment
column11: Oracle HCM, Change Management, UAT, Performance Management, Talent Management, Core HR

column1: SAP Supply Chain Planning Consultant - ePPDS Module
column2: Are you actively looking for a job? Programming.com is hiring an experienced SAP Supply Chain planning consultant to join our dynamic team in Bangalore and Mumbai!.  Notice Period: Immediate.  Work Mode: WFO-5 DAYS.  Interview Mode: Virtual.  Job Description: Responsibilities :  - The primary purpose of this job is to monitor & troubleshoot issues in daily required processes, deliver enhancements, and system fixes in SAP (RICEFW) when required to enhance business functionality.. - Responsible for overall release management in SAP related to Supply chain planning processes including but not limited to IBP, sales and operation planning, supply planning, production planning/detailed scheduling (PPDS), inventory planning, etc..  - SAP Supply Chain Planning consultant capable to provide solutions to complex medium term (tactical) and operational planning methodologies..  - Work with business stakeholders, architects, and implementation partners to enable business outcomes and ensure optimal functionality of SAP.. - Provide technical guidance and effort estimates on new solutions to optimize business expansion, ensure they are well documented and simple to understand..  - Provide support for ongoing operations and identify opportunities to improve processes.. - Responsible for change management communication, accountable for user acceptance tests and documentation prior to going live, and post go-live production support handover.. - Ensure adherence to global SAP design and architecture and participate in architecture review boards as needed..  - Responsible for ensuring all changes/enhancements meet required quality and compliance requirements (GxP, SOX).  Basic Qualifications : - Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Informatics or Engineering.  - Minimum 5 years of experience in developing and configuring solutions (RICEFW) in area of Supply chain planning processes using S4 ePPDS and/or IBP.. - Detailed hands-on / customizing knowledge of SAP S4 (MM/PP) and S4 ePPDS is a must.. - Knowledge of APO, ePPDS, S4, SAP IBP, and SAP HANA Enterprise is a pre-requisite.. - Good understanding in the following areas : Sales and Operation planning, Demand planning, Production planning/Detailed Scheduling, Deployment Planning, and Inventory Planning.. - Knowledge in integrations technologies using SAP PO, SAP CPI, and experience in working with Solution manager and ServiceNow for release management.. - Good understanding of SAP IBP modules (Response and Supply, Inventory, Sales and Operation Planning, Supply Chain Control Tower), and integration with S/4 HANA.. - Actively contributing to daily support with focus on SAP ePPDS module in S/4 HANA including Incident management, Change management, and Problem management. - Solid understanding and practical experience in incident and ChaRM process as well as in management of external service provider.  - Experience in development/configuration/solution evaluation/validation and deployment.  - Good analytical and communication skills; ability to communicate effectively both verbally and with written communications..  - Ability to listen, hear, and translate complex business requirements in simple easy to understand language..  - Capable of managing multiple projects and competing requirements with good time management skills..  - Ability to document, validate, challenge business requirements and translate them into functional IT specifications. - And select the correct solution (direction) that corresponds with the functional specifications..  - Strong customer focus, result-oriented and drive for excellence..  Functional Skills : - Knowledge and understanding of IBP and SAP ePPDS module and integration of IBP to S/4.  Non-Negotiable :  - Detailed understanding of S/4 ePPDS and good understanding of planning business processes as it relates to Demand and Supply..  - At least 1-2 implementations and 3-5 years of relevant experience in SAP ePPDS (preferably in S/4 HANA)..  - In depth knowledge in PP/DS Heuristics and optimizer..  - Extensively worked upon Detailed Scheduling board and its interactive functionalities both on on-premises and FIORI..  - Crystal clear understanding of CIF, its integration and master requirement of ePPDS.. - Hands on experience with alternative resource determination using SAP ePPDS in case overloads.. - Well equipped with identifying the optimal lot sizes for in-house production or external procurement and changing the planning situation (why-why analysis) via interactive planning using PPDS.. - Implementation and configuration experience preferred.  - However, if candidate has worked on support and roll out projects that experience should also be considered. IBP is a relatively new solution from SAP so candidates that have done APO in the past can also pick up IBP..  - Understanding of how DS tools in ePPDS work & help businesses in day-to-day functioning is expected..  Additional Skills/Preferences : - Good understanding of business processes in the Life sciences/Pharmaceutical domain and compliance with GxP. - Knowledge in: SAP modules of Materials Management (MM), Production Planning (PP) and Sales and Distribution (SD).. - APICS certification preferred.
column11: SAP, APICS, SAP SD, SAP MM, SAP PP, SAP CIF, SAP Integration, SAP SCM, RICEF, SAP System Configuration, SAP Implementation, SAP PPDS

column2: ?     We are currently seeking an experienced SAP S/4 HANA SD Consultant with a minimum of 1 End-to-End Implementation in S/4 HANA.      The ideal candidate will bring a wealth of expertise in various SAP SD functionalities, including Data Migration, Credit Management, Pricing, AATP (Advanced Available to Promise), BRF+ (Business Rules Framework plus), Settlement, and SD-LO Shipping.      This role requires hands-on experience in implementing and optimizing SAP S/4 HANA SD solutions.       Key Responsibilities:         1. End-to-End Implementation:    Lead or actively participate in at least one full-cycle SAP S/4 HANA SD implementation project.       2. Data Migration:    Oversee and execute data migration processes, ensuring the seamless transition of data from legacy systems to SAP S/4 HANA.       3. Credit Management:    Configure and optimize Credit Management processes within SAP SD, ensuring compliance with organizational credit policies.       4. Pricing:    Design and implement pricing strategies in SAP S/4 HANA SD, considering market dynamics and organizational objectives.       5. AATP (Advanced Available to Promise):    Implement and configure AATP functionality to enhance the accuracy of order promise and fulfillment.       6. BRF+ (Business Rules Framework Plus):    Utilize BRF+ for creating and managing business rules, enhancing flexibility and adaptability in SAP SD processes.       7. Settlement:    Manage settlement processes within SAP SD, ensuring accurate and timely financial transactions related to sales activities.       8. SD-LO Shipping:    Configure and optimize shipping processes within SD-LO, ensuring efficient and compliant handling of goods.       9. Collaboration:    Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including MM, FI, and other stakeholders, to ensure seamless integration and alignment with business processes.       10. Documentation:    Create and maintain detailed documentation for configurations, customizations, and technical solutions.       11. User Training:    Conduct user training sessions to educate end-users on SAP S/4 HANA SD functionalities and best practices.       Qualifications and Experience:       1. Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.     2. Experience: Minimum of 4-8 years of hands-on experience in SAP S/4 HANA SD, including at least one full-cycle implementation.     3. Technical Skills: Strong technical background with proficiency in SAP SD configuration.     4. Functional Knowledge: In-depth understanding of SAP SD functionalities, including Credit Management, Pricing, AATP, BRF+, Settlement, and SD-LO Shipping.

column2: Functional Expertise:    NetSuite Configuration and customization, Master Data Setup, Order to Cash, Procure to Pay, Inventory management, Mass Update, Data Import/ Export, and Documentation.       Technical Expertise:    Problem Analysis, Solution and design, Testing, Workflow and Scripting such as Client, Suite let, User Event and schedule.           Technical Expertise:A NetSuite Techno-Functional Consultant has a strong understanding of NetSuite's technical architecture, customization capabilities, and integration options       They have experience in configuring and customizing NetSuite modules to meet the unique business needs of clients     They may develop scripts, workflows, and customizations using NetSuite's SuiteScript, SuiteFlow, and other development tools     Functional Knowledge:The consultant has in-depth functional knowledge of various business processes, such as finance, accounting, sales, procurement, inventory management, and more     They understand how to map business requirements to NetSuite's capabilities and configure the system to achieve desired outcomes     Implementation:NetSuite Techno-Functional Consultants are involved in the end-to-end implementation of NetSuite for clients     This includes requirements gathering, solution design, configuration, data migration, and testing     They work closely with clients to understand their business processes and recommend best practices for implementing NetSuite     Customization and Integration:Consultants develop custom solutions and integrations to extend NetSuite's functionality and connect it with other business systems (eg, CRM, e-commerce platforms)     They may use APIs and integration tools to ensure seamless data flow between NetSuite and other applications     Training and Support:NetSuite Techno-Functional Consultants provide training to end-users to ensure they can effectively use and navigate the system     They offer ongoing support and troubleshooting to address issues that arise post-implementation     Optimization and Upgrades:Consultants assess and optimize existing NetSuite setups to improve efficiency and address evolving business needs     They guide clients through system upgrades and new feature implementations

column2: A career in our Managed Services team will provide you an opportunity to collaborate with a wide array of teams to help our clients implement and operate new capabilities, achieve operational efficiencies, and harness the power of technology      Our Application Evolution Services team will provide you with the opportunity to help organizations harness the power of their enterprise applications by optimizing the technology while driving transformation and innovation to increase business performance      We assist our clients in capitalizing on technology improvements, implementing new capabilities, and achieving operational efficiencies by managing and maintaining their application ecosystems      We help our clients maximize the value of their SAP investment by managing the support and continuous transformation of their solutions in the areas of sales, finance, supply chain, engineering, manufacturing and human capital                        As a Senior Manager, youll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:            Encourage everyone to have a voice and invite opinion from all, including quieter members of the team.      Deal effectively with ambiguous and unstructured problems and situations.      Initiate open and candid coaching conversations at all levels.      Move easily between big picture thinking and managing relevant detail.      Anticipate stakeholder needs, and develop and discuss potential solutions, even before the stakeholder realises they are required.      Contribute technical knowledge in area of specialism.      Contribute to an environment where people and technology thrive together to accomplish more than they could apart.      Navigate the complexities of cross-border and/or diverse teams and engagements.      Initiate and lead open conversations with teams, clients and stakeholders to build trust.      Uphold the firms code of ethics and business conduct.

column2: A SAP EWM (Extended Warehouse Management) Functional Professional is an individual with expertise in implementing and configuring the SAP EWM module for an organization     SAP EWM is a comprehensive solution that provides advanced warehouse management functionalities, such as inventory management, order fulfillment, cross-docking, labor management, and integration with other SAP modules and external systems     As a SAP EWM Functional Professional, your primary responsibilities may include:Requirement Gathering: Collaborating with business stakeholders to understand their warehouse management requirements, processes, and pain points     Solution Design: Translating business requirements into functional specifications and designing the SAP EWM solution     This involves configuring EWM settings, defining warehouse structures, and mapping business processes     System Configuration: Implementing the designed solution by configuring various EWM components, such as organizational units, warehouse structure, master data, storage control, and process-oriented settings     Integration: Collaborating with other SAP teams (such as SAP MM, SAP SD, or SAP TM) to ensure seamless integration between EWM and other modules     This involves defining interfaces, data mappings, and integration points     Testing and Training: Conducting system testing to validate the configured solution and performing end-to-end scenarios     Additionally, providing training and support to end-users for a smooth transition to the new system

You'll be the advocate for the client while guiding the technical team to implementation. column2: ?       10+ years full-time hands-on consulting experience in SAP MM     Minimum domain (functional) experience of 5 to 6 years (mandatory) in Purchase / Procurement             Mandatory Skills         Significant: S/4HANA MM application experience including configuration, design, testing, compliance implementation (at least 3 full project lifecycle and 3 support project experience)     Significant: Experience in basic functions, purchase order processing, sub-contracting, consignment, third party purchase, and STO     Significant: Experience in inventory management, invoice verification, and batch management      Significant: Extensive Experience in major enhancements (RICEFW) using APIs / userexits / BAPIs / BADIs     Significant: Experience in interfaces with legacy systems and IDOCs     Significant: Experience in Fiori, Cloud Platform etc.     Significant: Strong Integration knowledge with SD, APO, WM and FI and should have worked on complex business implementations     Significant: Strong ABAP debugging skills - with proven usage in production support environment                 Key Responsibilities / Role Description         Map client business requirements, processes and objectives; develops necessary product modifications to satisfy clients needs.     Design, customize, configure and testing of MM     Identify gaps, issues and work around solutions.     Act as liaison with client for troubleshooting: investigate, analyze, and solve software problems.     Handle changes or emergency transports as needed for high priority issues;     Document functional designs, test cases and results.     Proactively identify and propose business process and/or system enhancements     Provide consulting services on both new implementations and existing support projects     Actively engage with the client team by participating in the business process discussions. column2: Under general direction of the Director of Application Delivery Services, the individual may work as an individual contributor, team member or as a technical team leader.                                                        Individuals must be able to adjust to constant business change.                                                      Common types of changes include introduction of new organizations through mergers and acquisitions, evolving goals and strategies and emerging technologies. These changes require integration of solutions that can impact the overall system development activity & also provide client support, consultation and subject matter expertise for system development, maintenance, and support.                                                        Individuals in this role will provide technical leadership to their respective solution area. They analyze, design, develop and maintain code and applications to support business processes and functions.                                                      They also work on elements of large, complex installations. This associate may manage teams that support projects of low to high technical complexity and may oversee teams that work on solutions that span multiple domains, enterprise systems, and interface with external solutions                                                                                          What your background should look like                                                                    PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:              Leads major/critical projects/programs providing subject matter expertise and technical direction.      Leads project planning processes and works in conjunction with Business and System Analysts      Develops work plans or reviews other work plan timelines and manages workflows to meet project timeframes.      Responsible for identifying development tasks in support of project planning and estimation.      Works in conjunction with process team on the technical evaluation and selection process for system enhancements, by overseeing gap analysis studies, feasible alternative solutions, and recommending and/or approving the scope of modifications.      Manages conversion and migration designs.      Leads Project Teams developing solutions.      Participates in and makes performance recommendations to code and peer reviews.      Provides technical leadership for the definition and development of test plans and system documentation.      Reviews testing plans and system documentation.      Works with functional and business users to troubleshoot issues in production.      May provide production support as needed. Identifies recurring and potential problems.      Reviews and may assist in development of policies and procedures for production monitoring, scheduling, restart and recovery procedures.      Provides technical leadership, coaching, and mentoring to team members.      Develops reports and presentations for senior management, as needed.      Collaborates with technology teams across the Organization to leverage resources and expertise, establish software best practices and standards, and look for partnership opportunities      Consistently meet the goals of the Cencora & Alliance Health Core Competencies.              EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:              Bachelor s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related field, or equivalent work experience.      Typically has 10 or more years of IT work experience in application build, design, testing, and development experience.      Requires a broad level of understanding surrounding information systems and software architecture standards. Requires advanced to expert level knowledge and understanding of architecture, application design, system engineering and integration.                  MINIMUM SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITY REQUIREMENTS:              Requires training in fields such as information systems computer sciences or similar vocations obtained through completion of a four-year bachelor s degree program; normally requires a minimum of five (7+) years directly related and progressively responsible experience designing building testing and deploying enterprise SAP solutions; five (5) years of SAP application development (certification preferred) with in-depth experience in ABAP Workbench, ABAP Objects, BAPI, BADI s, RFC Smart Forms, Adobe Forms, IDOCs, BDC and ALV Programming.      Experience extending existing S/4, and/or writing entirely new S/4 programs and functions      Experience designing and maintaining Core Data Services (CDS) views and ODATA services      CDS tools using ABAP in Eclipse (ADT), and ABAP Managed Database Procedures (AMDP)      Proficient in ABAP/OO, ABAP CDS Views, Annotations, OData      Experience with ABAP on HANA development      HANA - Familiarity with the methods, functions, and capabilities of SAP HANA, how solutions should be integrated and architected, and additional supporting knowledge to develop and deploy SAP HANA in an enterprise SAP instance.      Experience in SAP Fiori (on-premise and cloud) and web user interface technologies like SAPUI5, JavaScript and Web IDE      Experience in setting up Fiori best practices and making sure application architecture and design is following best practices.      Work closely with customers, product owner, UX designers plus usability experts to present compelling user experience.      UI - Build a strategic & scalable UI UX applications and framework to harness the digital core and helps build long term strategy on how apps be integrated and architected, and additional supporting knowledge to develop and deploy UI applications in an enterprise SAP instance.      Good knowledge of HTML5, CSS, Java script      Experience in drafting & driving UI UX strategy & design      Portal Applications and Standards, Content Management Systems, AJAX, JavaScript and XML technologies      Experience with SAP Fiori Elements      SAP Fiori/ UI5 & Responsive Design Architecture.      Should Know SAP Fiori UI5 JavaScript and should be able to build Fiori Apps based on UI5 and JavaScript.      Should know Model View Controller (MVC) programming concept.      Experience with JavaScript / CSS support for multiple browsers such as IE, Firefox, Safari etc.      Experience in low code/no code platforms & implementation      Experience in SAP BTP, Business Application Studio, Restful ABAP Programming Model.

column2: A career in IBM Consulting is rooted by long-term relationships and close collaboration with clients across the globe. You'll work with visionaries across multiple industries to improve the hybrid cloud and AI journey for the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Your ability to accelerate impact and make meaningful change for your clients is enabled by our strategic partner ecosystem and our robust technology platforms across the IBM portfolio; including Software and Red Hat. Curiosity and a constant quest for knowledge serve as the foundation to success in IBM Consulting. In your role, you'll be encouraged to challenge the norm, investigate ideas outside of your role, and come up with creative solutions resulting in ground breaking impact for a wide network of clients. Our culture of evolution and empathy centers on long-term career growth and development opportunities in an environment that embraces your unique skills and experience. Your Role and Responsibilities As a consultant you will serve as a client-facing practitioner who sells, leads and implements expert services utilizing the breadth of IBM's offerings and technologies. A successful Consultant is regarded by clients as a trusted business advisor who collaborates to provide innovative solutions used to solve the most challenging business problems. You will work developing solutions that excel at user experience, style, performance, reliability and scalability to reduce costs and improve profit and shareholder value. Your primary responsibilities include: Build, automate and release solutions based on clients priorities and requirements. Explore and discover risks and resolving issues that affect release scope, schedule and quality and bring to the table potential solutions. Make sure that all integration solutions meet the client specifications and are delivered on time. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Minimum of 5+ years of relevant experience in Oracle Cloud Applications. Excellent (2-3 projects) implementation experience in cloud/fusion and 2/3 implementations in 12.2.9, Overall 8+ years of relevant experience in Oracle R12. 2.9 and fusion release 13. Reasonable exposure on P2P modules like iproc/PO/AP/FA/ebiz Tax/India localization/GL. Both Oracle R12. 2.9 and cloud Applications experience is must Oracle Projects exposure is added advantageSub ledger Accounting (SLA) knowledge. Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Oracle PLSQL. DBA Technical Skills. Performance Tuning.

column2: Job Role: Senior Lead SAP Integration Consultant SAP CPI (Band: E1) Job Description:  We are seeking a highly skilled Principal SAP Integration Consultant with 9-17 years of extensive experience, particularly in SAP CPI (Cloud Platform Integration) and PI (Process Integration). As a key member of our team, you will lead and drive the design, development, and implementation of complex SAP integration solutions for our clients. Key Responsibilities: Integration Strategy and Architecture: Develop integration strategies and architecture, aligning them with business goals and industry best practices, to ensure successful integration solutions using SAP CPI and PI. Technical Leadership and Mentorship: Provide technical leadership, mentorship, and guidance to a team of integration consultants, sharing expertise, best practices, and fostering continuous learning. Solution Design and Development: Lead the design and development of integration solutions, ensuring high performance, scalability, and reliability. Custom Development and Enhancements: Drive the development of custom components, adapters, and enhancements for integration solutions to meet unique project requirements. Performance Optimization and Scalability: Optimize integration solutions for enhanced performance, scalability, and efficiency, addressing any performance bottlenecks and fine-tuning the architecture. Stakeholder Engagement and Collaboration: Engage closely with stakeholders, including clients and cross-functional teams, to gather requirements, define integration strategies, and ensure successful project delivery. Quality Assurance and Best Practices: Establish and enforce adherence to quality assurance processes, coding standards, and best practices for integration development. Thought Leadership and Innovation: Stay updated with the latest advancements in SAP integration technologies and contribute to thought leadership within the organization and the industry. Documentation and Training: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for integration solutions, processes, and best practices. Conduct training sessions and knowledge sharing to disseminate expertise and keep the team updated on the latest advancements in SAP integration technologies. Qualifications: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. 9-14 years of progressive experience in SAP CPI and PI, showcasing a significant role in design, development, and deployment. Expert understanding of integration concepts, methodologies, and industry best practices. Proficient in SAP CPI, SAP PI/PO, SAP Cloud Platform Integration, and relevant tools. Extensive experience with other SAP modules and technologies related to integration is highly advantageous. Outstanding leadership, analytical, and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities, with a demonstrated capability to collaborate effectively in a team environment. Preferred Certifications: SAP Certified Development Associate - SAP Cloud Platform Integration (C_CPI_13) SAP Certified Development Associate - Process Integration with SAP NetWeaver (C_PO_75)
column11: Cloud Platform Integration, PI, Integration Strategy, Sap Cpi, Cpi, Sap Cloud Platform

column2: Lead the design, architecture, and implementation of end-to-end SAP solutions for Order to Cash processes, encompassing SD, WM/EWM, IM, AATP, SAP TM and GTS     Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into scalable and efficient SAP solutions.     Provide strategic guidance and thought leadership in SAP solution architecture, ensuring alignment with business objectives and industry best practices.     Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand complex requirements and translate them into scalable and efficient SAP solutions.     Mentor and coach junior team members, providing guidance on solution design, configuration, and integration to foster their professional growth and development.     Drive innovation and continuous improvement by evaluating emerging SAP technologies and recommending solutions to enhance business processes and drive operational excellence.     Act as a subject matter expert on SAP S4/HANA and/or ECC platforms, leveraging deep technical expertise to guide solution design and implementation.     Lead cross-functional teams in the configuration, customization, and integration of SAP modules, ensuring adherence to architectural standards and quality guidelines.     Partner with business leaders and IT teams to develop strategic roadmaps for SAP initiatives, prioritizing projects and investments based on business value and impact.     Stay abreast of SAP advancements and industry trends, sharing insights and best practices with the team and stakeholders to drive continuous learning and improvement.     Act as a liaison between business users and IT teams, facilitating communication and ensuring alignment of SAP solutions with business objectives.     Troubleshoot and resolve complex SAP issues, including system errors, performance issues, and data inconsistencies.     Provide knowledge and expertise to department heads and process owners in identifying opportunities for technology and prioritizing initiatives.     Conduct regular system audits to identify and address areas for improvement, ensuring maximum efficiency and effectiveness of SAP systems.             Education special trainings:         Bachelor s Degree from an accredited university in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, Supply Chain Management, or equivalent field required.     APICS accredited or professional supply chain accreditation preferred but not essential.     Lean sigma certification preferred (eg, Lean Practitioner, Green Belt).         Qualifications experience:         Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or related field; Masters degree preferred.     Minimum of 7 years of progressive experience in SAP solution architecture and implementation, with a focus on Order to Cash/Logistics processes.     Extensive functional knowledge of SAP modules including SD, WM/EWM, IM, AATP, APO, with a proven track record of delivering complex SAP projects.     Expertise in SAP S4/HANA and/or ECC platforms, including hands-on experience in solution design, configuration, and customization.     Excellent communication skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate effectively with senior stakeholders.     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a strategic mindset and a passion for driving business transformation.     SAP certifications in relevant modules or technologies are highly desirable.         Physical mental requirements:          Demonstrated professional experience in IT/IS and/or other related business discipline is required     Ability to understand systems, interrelationships and recommend enhancements, and building IS strategy     Demonstrated leadership, interpersonal, analytical, change management and communication skills     Ability to work effectively across functions and build successful relationships in global matrix organization     Awareness of current and future trends in the industry and competitors

column2: Responsible for taking ownership and driving functional and technical changes and maintaining Salesforce.      The role requires both technical expertise and a deep understanding of business processes.      Collaborating closely with business stakeholders to understand and document business requirements, design, and configure the system ensuring alignment with business needs and scalability.         Responsibilities:             Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and understand business requirements related to Salesforce implementation.     System Design and Configuration: Design and configure Salesforce solutions based on identified business requirements, leveraging declarative tools and customization. Ability to configure Roles, Profiles, Permission Sets, Sharing Rules, Public Groups, etc. Creation of new Objects, Fields, Validation Rules, Page layouts, Lookup relationships, etc. Configure approval processes, reports, and dashboards.     Custom Development: Lead custom development efforts (building complex workflows, lightning app building, customizing experience cloud, configuring/creating notifications), ensuring alignment with business needs.     Integration Management: Develop and manage integrations between Salesforce and other enterprise systems.     Data Management: Understand data flow, structure, and mapping. Ensuring data integrity and completeness.     Testing and Quality Assurance: Develop and execute test plans to ensure the quality of Salesforce solutions, troubleshoot issues, and coordinate user acceptance testing.     User Training and Support: Conduct user training sessions and provide ongoing support to ensure the successful adoption of Salesforce within the organization.     Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of Salesforce configurations, customizations, integrations, and processes.     Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize the use of Salesforce in various business processes.     Stay Informed: Stay abreast of the latest Salesforce features, updates, and best practices to continuously enhance system capabilities             Qualifications:         Bachelors degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field.     Salesforce Certified Administrator and Salesforce Certified Platform App Builder will be preferred.     Proven experience as a Salesforce Techno-Functional Consultant in a similar role. Good understanding of Salesforce Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Pardot (Marketing Cloud), and Experience Cloud.      Experience in visual basic coding.     Experience with Lightning components and the Salesforce Lightning platform.     Strong understanding of Salesforce configurations, customizations, and integration concepts.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.     Ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.     Certification of Salesforce Sales Cloud or Service Cloud will be an advantage

column2: You will facilitate the implementation and support of SAP S/4HANA Financials with focus on Controlling within a global matrix organization, collaborating with IT and Business colleagues.                  You will create IT designs specifications and ensure the quality of IT designs cooperating with the Finance Application Manager.      You will configure the SAP Controlling module to meet business requirements, including integration points with other SAP modules or other applications, following SAP standard methodologies and EB Global Template.      You will contribute as project member in IT projects, including full SAP Roll-Out projects.      You will support business via incidents change requests for Cost Element and Cost Center Accounting, Profit Center Accounting, Product Costing, Profitability Analysis (including value flow from different SAP logistic modules), Project System, Period end activities such as Results Analysis, Unsettled Costs, Month End Close, Overhead assessment and settlement.      You will document implemented SAP Controlling solutions to ensure successful end user support. You will create training material for the business key users conduct key user trainings. You will support the business key users in developing work instructions conducting end user training.      You will ensure quality and best practices in the SAP Controlling functional domain by adhering to the global EagleBurgmann SAP solution template, SAP standards, knowledge base best practices.              Qualifications    arrow_right            Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Finance, or Economics with a strong interest in affinity with Information Technology. Alternatively, a Bachelor s degree in computer science with minor in business administration.      Minimum of 10 years job specific and hands-on SAP CO work experience with demonstrated professional growth and achievement. Prior work experience in a manufacturing organization of comparable size, business diversity, scope and complexity a plus.      SAP S/4 HANA experience is a major plus.      At least 3 full life cycle implementations of SAP roll outs. International roll out experience will be a plus.      Strong understanding experience in Integration of SAP Controlling with SAP Production Planning (PP), SAP Material Management (MM), and SAP Sales Distribution (SD) modules.      Strong English written and verbal communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills to effectively exercise tact, discretion, judgment, and diplomacy when interacting and/or negotiating with internal and external customers and senior management.      Highly motivated self-starter.      Ability to work effectively in a diverse and global work group and to achieve results through global team efforts.      Ability to perform in a high-pressure environment and/or crisis and render good decisions to resolve the problems, maintain safety and ensure adherence to central and local policies and procedures.      Willingness to travel global for project related tasks.
